title: Hurricane Roslyn Strengthens to Category 4 and Heads Toward  Mexico
description: Roslyn became a Category 4 hurricane on Saturday. Forecasters warned it could bring coastal flooding and dangerous winds to cities along the Pacific Coast.

title: Ian Hamilton, 97, Who Stole a Scottish Relic from Westminster Abbey, Dies
description: In an audacious caper, he and three other Scottish nationalists liberated the Stone of Destiny nearly 700 years after England had seized it from Scotland.

title: Boris Johnson Is Back in Britain, and Back in the Running for Prime Minister
description: The former Conservative leader, who was forced out of office after scandals this summer, hasn’t declared his candidacy, but dozens of party lawmakers already support him.

title: Some Palestinians Move Into Caves to Resist Israeli Expulsion
description: Israel’s Supreme Court has ordered the removal of about 1,200 Palestinians from their villages in the occupied West Bank. The United Nations says that could amount to a war crime.

title: Did the Pandemic Change Your Personality? Possibly.
description: For more than two years, Covid disrupted social rituals and rites of passage. Now a recent study suggests we have become less extroverted, creative, agreeable and conscientious. The declines in some traits were sharper among young people.

title: How Tumultuous Forces of Brexit Divided U.K.’s Conservative Party
description: Some experts link Liz Truss’s downfall to the ripple effect of Britain’s departure from the European Union and the bitter, ideologically opposed factions it created in her party.

title: Scare Tactics
description: It’s Halloween season, time for two-pound bags of fun-size candy and scary movies that haunt your dreams.

title: Getting People Back on Trains, After the Pandemic Turned Many to Cars
description: While the federal government is committed to a multibillion-dollar improvement to train service, an already long schedule may face delays.

title: Scenes From the Front Line
description: The war in Ukraine has reached into every pocket of the country — from urban areas to the countryside, where soldiers monitor drones to pinpoint deadly attacks and civilians brace for destruction.

title: Zar Amir Ebrahimi, an Iranian Exile, Channels Trauma in ‘Holy Spider’
description: Zar Amir Ebrahimi, who had to flee Iran after an intimate tape was leaked, has been transfixed by the protests erupting there as her film “Holy Spider” is released in the U.S.

title: Ukraine War Amputees Find New Limbs, and Hope
description: It did not take long for amputees to begin coming off the Ukrainian battlefield. Our photographer captured their new fight, to lead ordinary lives again.

title: Cultural Bereavement: Naming the Grief Refugees May Feel
description: There is a name for the specific type of grief that both refugees and migrants experience. It’s called “cultural bereavement.”

title: Hassles of Cross-Border Trains Hamper EU’s Green Ambitions
description: One man is on a mission to find and suggest fixes for all of the flaws making international rail travel in Europe surprisingly hard. Getting more people on trains is key to meeting E.U. climate goals.

title: Charter Airline Quits U.K. Plan to Fly Asylum Seekers to Rwanda
description: Amid protests, Privilege Style said it would stop running the deportation flights as part of Britain’s highly criticized effort. The move has left the deal in further disarray.

title: Russian Strikes Hit Cities Across Ukraine
description: Ukraine’s military scrambled fighter jets, and people took shelter in basements.

title: China’s Leader, Xi Jinping, Elevates Loyalists in Party Elite
description: A new lineup of the Communist Party elite will limit potential resistance to Mr. Xi’s agenda of bolstering security and expanding state sway over the economy.

title: China Hangs on Xi’s Every Word. His Silence Also Speaks Volumes.
description: At the important Communist Party congress this week, the Chinese leader didn’t mention two long-repeated maxims. To many, it’s a warning of the turbulent times ahead.

title: Using Adoptions, Russia Turns Ukrainian Children Into Spoils of War
description: Thousands of Ukrainian children have been transferred to Russia. “I didn’t want to go,” one girl told The New York Times from a foster home near Moscow.
